trend_summary: Across the sequence, small villages expand marginally, cropland consolidates and spreads, and contiguous forest cover retreatsâ€”most noticeably in the centre-east and northern ridge. A new north-south corridor appears, likely a road or utility line. Despite these shifts, the landscape stays agriculture-dominated, with low, dispersed settlement and no emergence of dense urban fabric.
notable_changes: Expansion of cropland patches replacing forest in the central-eastern zone.
Noticeable forest loss and new clear-cuts on the northern ridge.
Modest outward growth of several village clusters, especially near the centre.
Appearance of a straight north-south linear corridor, suggesting new road or utility infrastructure.
Subtle densification of secondary road network linking hamlets and fields.
